page.title: 18FRANKLANDS WOOD
page.content: This plantation covers 31 Hectares and is of 23 yr old Scots Pine & Lodgepole Pine. There is a fine stone wall that stands in very good condition in this area. Here and there trees are managing to establish themselves on heaps of shale left from mine workings. The former footpaths to the quarry are now completely obliterated. When it is dry the access road is just passable by car through the locked wicket gate in the SE corner. A water collecting tank and pipeline for Broomflat Farms lies within the plantation. Within the plantation there is also a 0.5 Hectare wedge- shaped planting of Scots Pine in rank heather and bilberry. It lies between the Landrover track and the fence in the NE corner. Roe deer are resident here and there is a well-patronised pheasant shoot.
